text: NF-kappaB and PKC ( s ) Mediate Human MDM Survival in Response to M-CSF Stimulation
Since PKC and NF-kappaB are critical in cell survival [ 37 ] , [ 38 ] , we hypothesized that M-CSF promoted cell survival through PKC in human MDMs .

To detect apoptosis , the expression of cleaved <extra_id_0> caspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a marker of apoptosis , was analyzed in the presence or absence of M-CSF and PKC inhibitors .

text: In MDMs pretreated with PKC inhibitors ( Ro-31-8220 , Go-6976 , or BAPTA / AM ) and stimulated with M-CSF , cleaved <extra_id_0> caspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was elevated to levels of cells treated with vehicle alone ( Figure 3A ) .

text: In contrast , cells incubated with M-CSF and vehicle had less cleaved <extra_id_0> caspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> than cells incubated with vehicle alone or M-CSF with PKC inhibitors .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation less <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme cleaved <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Protein_catabolism cleaved <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme caspase-3 <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: These data supported the hypothesis that M-CSF - induced NF-kappaB activity was regulated by conventional PKCs , not novel PKCs .

To confirm that PKC inhibition decreased cell survival , cells were treated with M-CSF in the absence or presence of PKC inhibitors and then also examined for apoptosis by <extra_id_0> Annexin V <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / PI staining .
PKC inhibitors in the presence of M-CSF reduced the number of <extra_id_0> Annexin V <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / PI negative MDMs compared to cells treated with M-CSF alone ( Figure 3B ) .
These observations further suggested that MDM survival is promoted by M-CSF and critically involves conventional PKCs and NF-kappaB activity .
